japanese: 本日のメイン、首里城にとうちゃーく！
translation: Today's main event is a visit to Shurijo Castle!

japanese:
沖縄観光って言ったら、
やっぱりここってイメージがあるわ。
translation:
When you think of Okinawa tourism,
you definitely imagine this place, right?

japanese:
お城って言われて想像してたよりも緑が多くて、
いい所だね。
translation:
There's more greenery than I imagined in a castle.
What a nice place.

japanese:
この門は見たことがある。
守礼門……だよね？
translation:
I've seen this gate before.
This is...Shureimon, right?

japanese:
ええ、そうです。
確かお札にも描かれていましたね。
translation:
Yes, that's right.
I think it was also depicted on a banknote.

japanese:
ほら、上杉さんも早く早く！
置いてっちゃいますよ～！
translation:
Hey, Uesugi-san, hurry up!
You'll be left behiiind!

japanese: ……ああ、いま行く。
translation: ...Yeah, I'm coming now.

japanese:
（姉妹揃ってどっか行っちまった時は
　どうなるかと思ったが……俺の杞憂だったか）
translation:
(I was worried about what would happen if
 the sisters went somewhere together...
 But maybe I was just being paranoid.)

japanese:
（むしろ、戻ってきた後のほうが
　雰囲気が良くなったくらいだな）
translation:
(Actually, the atmosphere is even better
 after they got back.)

japanese:
上杉さん。
門についてる看板、なんて書いてあるんですか？
translation:
Uesugi-san, what's written on the sign
hanging on the gate?

japanese:
看板じゃなくて扁額（へんがく）だ。
書かれてるのは、確か
『守禮之邦（しゅれいのくに）』だったかな。
translation:
It's not a sign, it's a plaque.
I think it says 'Shurei no Kuni.'

japanese: しゅれーのくに？
translation: Shurei no Kuni?

japanese: 『礼節を重んずる国』って意味だ。
translation: It means, 'a country that values etiquette.'

japanese: はあ、なるほど。
translation: Oooh, I see.

japanese: お前、わかってないだろ。
translation: You obviously don't.

japanese:
ねえフー君！
門の前で一緒に写真撮りましょ？
translation:
Hey, Fu-kun!
Let's take a picture together
in front of the gate!

japanese:
あっ！
じゃあ、私が撮ってあげるね。
translation:
Ah!
Then, I'll take the picture for you.

japanese:
あらら、先を越されちゃったか。
三玖、どうしよっか？
translation:
Oh my, someone beat us to it.
What should we do, Miku?

japanese: ここは礼節を守って順番待ちで。
translation: Let's follow proper etiquette and wait in line.

japanese:
は？　二乃と２人でなのか？
せっかくなんだし、みんなで撮ればいいだろ？
translation:
Huh? Just the two of us?
Why not take a group photo since we're all here?

japanese:
それは当然、撮りますが？
私たちの集合写真はあなたが撮ってくださいね。
translation:
Of course we will.
But you'll take our group photo for us, right?

japanese:
ほら、フー君！
おしゃべりしてないでカメラのほうを向く！
translation:
Come on, Fu-kun!
Don't talk, look at the camera!

japanese:
上杉さん、これは思い出です。
最高の思い出を作るんですよね？
translation:
Uesugi-san, this is a memory.
We're making the best memories, right?

japanese:
……まあ、そうだな。
観光地で記念写真はお決まりみたいなもんか。
translation:
Well...yeah.
Taking commemorative photos
at tourist destinations is the thing to do.

japanese:
ふふっ！
じゃあ、腕組んじゃおうかしら。
translation:
Teehee!
Then, let's link arms.

japanese:
ちょっと待て！
くっつきすぎだって！
translation:
Wait a minute!
You're too close!

japanese: フータロー、逃げてちゃダメ。
translation: Futaro, don't run away.

japanese: 順番待ちがあるんだから早くしようねー？
translation: There's a line, so could we speed things up a little, okay?

japanese: おい、まさかお前らも……。
translation: Hey, don't tell me you guys as well...

japanese:
上杉さん、笑って笑って！
はいはーい、撮りますよー。
translation:
Uesugi-san, smile, smile!
Okie dokie, and here we gooo!

japanese:
ねえ、フー君。
腕組んで歩きましょ？
translation:
Hey, Fu-kun.
Let's walk while linking arms.

japanese: 腕なんか組んだら、歩きづらくて疲れちまうだろ。
translation:
If we link arms, it'll be hard to walk,
and we'll get tired.

japanese:
だ、大丈夫。
フータローが腕組んでくれたら、私も頑張れるから。
translation:
I-it's okay.
If you link arms with me,
I can do my best, too.

japanese: お前、大分疲れてないか？
translation: Are you sure you're not already tired?

japanese:
首里城って結構、高低差あるんだ。
疲れてきた……。
translation:
There's quite a difference in elevation
at Shurijo Castle.
I'm starting to get tired...

japanese:
まあ、午前中から歩き回ってるからな。
俺もさすがに疲れ気味ではあるが。
translation:
Well, we've been walking around since this morning.
I'm also starting to feel a little tired.

japanese:
疲れたらお姉さんのとこへ来てもいいんだよ？
肩くらい、タダで貸してあげちゃう。
translation:
If you're tired, you can come to your big sis, you know?
I'll lend you my shoulder for free.

japanese: タダより高いものはないって言葉もあるよな？
translation:
There's a saying that there's nothing more expensive
than something free, you know?

japanese:
観光なんだから、のんびり歩けばいいのよ。
ね、フー君。
translation:
It's a tourist attraction,
so we can just take it easy and have ourselves a stroll.
Right, Fu-kun?

japanese: そう言うなら、のんびりさせてくれ……。
translation: If that's the case, please let me take it easy...

japanese:
みんな遅ーい！
ほら、また門が見えてきたよー！
translation:
You're all so SLOOOW!
Look, we can see another gate!

japanese: それなら正殿までもう少しか。
translation: Then let's go a little further to the main hall.

japanese: あっ……。
translation: Ah...

japanese:
なんだ？　急に立ち止まって。
まさか足を挫いたとか……。
translation:
What's wrong? Why did you suddenly stop?
Did you twist your ankle or something?

japanese: ううん、大丈夫。
translation: No, I'm fine.

japanese:
石垣に石段……。
あの門、まるでお城の城門みたいだなって。
translation:
The stone walls and stone stairs...
That gate looks just like an actual castle.

japanese:
首里城も城だからな。
本州の城とは造りが違うようだが、
似てる雰囲気はあるんだろ。
translation:
Well, Shurijo Castle is a castle after all.
Although the construction is different from the 
mainland castles, it does have a similar atmosphere.

japanese:
櫓門（やぐらもん）は、
地形を活かした山城って感じがして格好いい。
translation:
The Yaguramon gate has a cool mountain castle vibe to it
that takes advantage of the surrounding terrain.

japanese:
じゃあ、石段のところで
門をバックに記念写真撮っておくか。
translation:
Alright, how about taking a commemorative photo
with the gate in the background at the staircase?

japanese: ２人で？
translation: Just the two of us?

japanese:
集合写真で。
また順番待ちとか言い出されたら、
時間がかかっちまう。
translation:
A group photo.
If you say you're gonna take turns again, 
it'll take too long.

japanese: 残念。
translation: Too bad.

japanese: じゃあ、みんな集合で。
translation: All right, gather around, everyone.

japanese:
おお、ここが正殿か！
さすがに豪華だな！
translation:
Wow, so this is the Seiden main hall!
It's really luxurious!

japanese: 青空に建物の色が映えて綺麗……！
translation:
The building's color looks beautiful 
against the blue sky...!

japanese:
あと首里城と言えば、やっぱり
この縞模様の中庭だよな！
translation:
And when someone says Shurijo Castle, 
you definitely think of this striped courtyard!

japanese:
うなーですよ、上杉さん！
うなー！
translation: Unaaa, Uesugi-san! Unaaa!

japanese: は？　なんだ？
translation: Huh? What now?

japanese:
この中庭のことだよ。
御庭（うなー）って言うんだって。
translation:
She's talking about this courtyard.
It's called 'una' in the Okinawan dialect.

japanese:
ああ、そういう意味か。
一応知ってたぞ、下調べはしたし。
translation:
Oh, I see. I actually did know that,
since I did some research beforehand.

japanese: さっきの四葉の言い方だとね。
translation: It's the way you were saying it before, Yotsuba.

japanese:
だよな。
なにを唸りだしたのかと思った。
全然説明になってなかったし。
translation:
Exactly.
I thought you were groaning or something.
Your interjection didn't exactly help.

japanese:
ししし～。
あれくらい感覚で受け止めてください。
translation:
Heeheehee!
Just take it as it is, please.

japanese: 無理言うな……。
translation: Don't make me do the impossible...

japanese:
それじゃ、どこから見て回る？
見所は多そうだけど。
translation:
Anyway, where should we go next?
There seems to be a lot to see.

japanese:
私は奥書院に行ってみる。
建物が和風らしいし、庭園も見てみたい。
translation:
I want to go to the Okushoin.
It's supposed to look like a traditional Japanese-style 
building, and I want to see the garden too.

japanese:
左側にあるのが北殿かしら？
確かショップが入ってるのよね。
translation:
Is that the Kitaden north hall on the left?
I think there's a shop in there, right?

japanese:
右の南殿には、沖縄の伝統工芸品が
展示されているようですね。
見学してみたいです。
translation:
Traditional Okinawan crafts are being displayed 
in the Nanden south hall on the right.
I'd like to visit it.

japanese:
……わかっちゃいたが、
毎回、見事にバラバラだよな。
translation:
...I knew it.
We're all going in different directions again.

japanese:
五つ子あるあるです。
上杉さんは、どこか見たい所はないんですか？
translation:
It's a common problem among quintuplets.
Uesugi-san, is there anywhere in particular 
that you want to see?

japanese:
正殿は外せないとして、
他は特には考えてなかったな。
まあ、適当に見て回るとするか。
translation:
Well, you can't skip the Seiden main hall,
but I haven't really thought about where else to go.
I'll just look around randomly.

japanese: 四葉、ちょっと。
translation: Hey, Yotsuba.

japanese:
ん？　一花？
どうしたの？
translation: Hm? What is it, Ichika?

japanese: いいから、こっちこっち。
translation: Never mind, come over here.

japanese: どうしたの？
translation: What's up?

japanese:
あの、さ。
私が言えたことじゃないんだけどね？
translation: Well, it's not really my place to say.

japanese: 四葉も、本当にしたいことをしなよ。
translation: Yotsuba, you should do what you really want to do.

japanese: 一花……。
translation: Ichika...

japanese:
まあ、私も、
四葉たちが背中を押してくれたおかげで
やっとなんだけどさ。
translation:
I mean, thanks to you and the others pushing me forward,
I finally made up my mind.

japanese: 前にも同じこと、言ってくれた。
translation: You said the same thing before.

japanese:
うん。
だけどもう一度、伝えたくて。
四葉は――
translation:
Yes.
But I just wanted to say it again.
Yotsuba, you're%p-2;――

japanese: 昔のことよりも、大切なのはいまなんだよね。
translation:
What's important now is the present,
not the past, right?

japanese: えっ？
translation: Huh?

japanese: あれから、私も色々あったんだ。
translation: Since then, a lot has happened to me too.

japanese: 一花、私ね、もう過去には頼らないって決めたよ。
translation: Ichika, I've decided not to rely on the past anymore.

japanese: それって……。
translation: That means...

japanese: 一番大切なのはいまで――
translation: The most important thing%p-2;――

japanese:
いまの自分がどう思って
どうしたいのかを、ちゃんと考えてるから。
translation:
Is to think about how I feel
and what I want in the present moment.

japanese: だから大丈夫。
translation: So, it's okay.

japanese: そっか。
translation: Oh, I see.

japanese:
うん。
心配してくれて、ありがと。
translation:
Yes.
Thank you for worrying about me.

japanese: 私、一花のことも応援してるから。
translation: I'm also supporting you, Ichika.

japanese:
ていうか、四葉。
いま話してる時、フータロー君のこと見てなかった？
translation:
By the way, Yotsuba, when we were talking earlier,
were you not looking at Futaro-kun?

japanese:
えっ！？
さあ、なんのことでございましょう～？
translation:
Huh?!
What do you mean?

japanese: 顔、赤くなってる。
translation: Your face is turning red.

japanese:
きょ、今日は暑いよね！
なんか火照っちゃったかな！
translation:
I-it's hot today, right?
Maybe I'm feeling flushed!

japanese:
あっ、ほら。
フータロー君、こっち来たよ。
translation: Oh, look, Futaro-kun is coming this way.

japanese:
うええっ！？　ええと！
一花、見たいとこあるから一緒に行こ！
ほら早く早く！
translation:
WHAAA?! Umm!
There's somewhere I want to go,
so let's go together. Hurry up, hurry up!

japanese:
仕方ないなぁ。
付き合ってあげましょう。
translation:
Alright, I guess I have no choice.
I'll tag along.

japanese:
もう答えを出してしまっているとしても……
本当にそれでいいのですか？
translation:
Even if you've already given an answer...
is it really okay?

japanese: そんなの、私は……。
translation: I just can't handle it...

japanese: こだわっているのは、私だけなのでしょうか。
translation: Am I the only one who's this fixated on that?

japanese:
五月か？
こんな所でぼーっとして、どうした。
translation:
Itsuki?
What are you doing spacing out here?

japanese:
上杉君！？
い、いつからそこに！
translation: Uesugi-kun?! H-how long have you been there?!

japanese: なんだよ、俺が声をかけたらまずいのか？
translation:
What?
Is it bad for me to call out to you?

japanese:
そういうわけでは……。
あの……聞いていたのですか？
translation:
It's not that...
Did you...hear what I said?

japanese:
ん？　なにをだ？
俺はいまここに来たばかりだが。
translation:
Huh? About what?
I just got here.

japanese: ……１人なんですね。
translation: ...You're alone.

japanese:
ああ、あいつら好き勝手に見て回りやがって、
気が付いたら全員どっか行っちまってた。
translation:
Yeah, everyone else was looking around on their own
and then they all disappeared.

japanese: そうですか。
translation: I see.

japanese:
それで？　なんかあったのか？
さっきから溜め息ばっかついてるぞ。
translation:
So, did something happen?
You've been sighing a lot lately.

japanese: 別に、なんでもありません。
translation: No, it's nothing.

japanese:
わかったぞ、腹が減ったんだろ？
お前は腹が減るとすぐ元気がなくなるしな。
translation:
I know what it is. You're hungry, aren't you?
You always get weak when you're hungry.

japanese:
……あなたが私を
どのように見ているのか、よくわかりました。
translation: ...I understand now how you view me, Uesugi-kun.

japanese:
もうすぐ大学生なのですから、
少しはデリカシーというものを学んではどうです？
translation:
Since you'll be a university student soon,
why don't you learn some subtlety?

japanese:
お、おう。
考えておく。
translation:
S-sure.
I'll think about it.

japanese: とにかく、いまはまだ――
translation: Anyway, for now%p-2;――

japanese:
あっ！
五月、ここにいたんだ！
ついでに上杉さんも発見です！
translation: Ah! Itsuki, you're here! And I found Uesugi-san too!

japanese: なんか、悪かったな。
translation: My bad, I guess.

japanese: なぜ、あなたが謝るのですか？
translation: Why are you apologizing?

japanese: いや、俺が迷惑かけちまってるわけだし。
translation: Well, I've been causing you trouble.

japanese:
はぁ……。
少しは気にしていたのですね。
translation:
*sigh*
So you do care a little bit.

japanese: ですが、あなただけが悪いわけではありませんから。
translation: However, it's not simply your fault.

japanese: とにかく、いまはまだ――
translation: Anyway, for now%p-2;――

japanese:
あっ！
五月、ここにいたんだ！
ついでに上杉さんも発見です！
translation: Ah! Itsuki, you're here! And I found Uesugi-san too!

japanese: なんでもなくはないよな。
translation: Doesn't seem like it's nothing.

japanese:
なにか、俺に言いたいこととか
できることがあるなら、遠慮なく言ってくれ。
translation:
If there's anything you want to say to me
or anything I can do, don't hesitate to tell me.

japanese:
あなたという人は。
普段あれだけノーデリカシーなのに……。
translation:
For someone like you,
who usually lacks all sense of subtlety...

japanese: こういう時は気を遣えるのですから、不思議です。
translation: It's strange how you're considerate at times like this.

japanese: とにかく、いまはまだ――
translation: Anyway, for now%p-2;――

japanese:
あっ！
五月、ここにいたんだ！
ついでに上杉さんも発見です！
translation: Ah! Itsuki, you're here! And I found Uesugi-san too!

japanese: フータロー君も一緒だったんだね。
translation: You were with Futaro-kun, huh?

japanese:
あれ？
もしかして、お邪魔だった？
translation:
Oh?
Was I interrupting something?

japanese:
そんなんじゃねーよ。
違います。
translation:
Of course not.
Not at all.

japanese: ふーん、そうなの。
translation: Mmm, I see.

japanese: それで、みんな揃ってどうしたんですか？
translation: I see. So why did you all show up here?

japanese:
うん。
大体見終わったし、そろそろ休憩にしようかなって。
translation:
Well, we're almost done looking around,
so I thought we should take a break soon.

japanese:
お土産屋さんやカフェがあるんだって。
そこに行ってみない？
translation:
There's a souvenir shop and a cafe nearby.
Shall we go there?

japanese: それと五月のお腹も心配だし。
translation: I'm worried about Itsuki's stomach too.

japanese:
も、もう！
まだ我慢できるレベルです！
translation:
H-hey!
I can still hold on!

japanese:
……ですが、我慢は体に毒とも言いますよね。
行きましょうか。
translation:
But, they do say
that holding back is harmful to the body. Shall we go?

japanese: （……五月、なにを言いかけてたんだ？）
translation: (What was Itsuki about to say?)
